TEXT: CARDINAL . NORP The applicant company , which has its seat of business in Ernstbrunn ( GPE ) , carries out cattle and pig slaughter , and is therefore liable to agricultural marketing charges , calculated on the basis of the number of animals slaughtered , to be paid to PERSON ( ORG ) under LAW ( Agrarmarktgesetz ) .

CARDINAL . On CARDINAL DATE the ORG issued a payment order against the applicant company , ordering it to pay outstanding contributions for DATE and DATE in the amount of MONEY ( ORG ) and , in addition , imposing a surcharge for failure to pay , amounting to PERCENT of the unpaid contributions . The applicant company appealed against the order . It argued in particular that the above system was contrary to the rules of ORG on state aid . It also asked for oral hearings to be held on the appeal and also asked that the proceedings for enforcing the payment order be suspended .

CARDINAL . The Federal Minister of Agriculture , Forestry , Environment and Water ( PERSON für Land- PERSON , PERSON ) , acting as the appeal authority , dismissed the applicant company ’s appeal on DATE without holding a hearing .

CARDINAL . As regards the applicant ’s argument that the ORG contributions were levied for financing activities , the ORG quality programme , which was not in accordance with ORG law , the Federal Minister found that after the decision of ORG of DATE ( C(CARDINAL)CARDINAL ) , the applicant company was in a position to know precisely which charges it had to pay . In that decision ORG had expressed that it had no objection to the ORG programmes and quality mark registered as state aid NN CARDINALA/CARDINAL ( “ PERSON das ORG und das ORG ” ) , because that state aid was in accordance with the Common Market provided for in LAW establishing ORG . The Federal Minister referred further to ORG decision of DATE , no . PERSON , according to which also the levying of ORG contributions was in accordance with the relevant provisions of ORG law ( se § § DATE below ) . The Federal Minister further held that it had not been necessary to hold a hearing because a hearing was only held if a decision was taken by a panel on an appeal against the decision of a tax office or a regional directorate of finance , which was not the case here .
CARDINAL . On DATE dismissed the request for suspension of the enforcement .

CARDINAL . Thereupon the applicant company lodged complaints with ORG and ORG against the ORG decision . Before ORG the applicant company complained , inter alia , that the surcharge imposed violated its constitutional right to property . Before ORG the applicant company complained that the appeal authority was not a court within the meaning of the case - law of ORG which prevented it from having the lawfulness of the decision by ORG of DATE reviewed by ORG in proceedings under LAW . As regards the imposition of the surcharge the applicant company complained that the findings of fact were insufficient . In particular the authority had failed to establish whether the objective and subjective elements of the offence ( objektiven und subjektiven Tatbildvoraussetzungen ) had been met . Relying on LAW it complained further that no public hearing had been held and that no impartial tribunal established by law decided on the criminal charge against it ( “ es ist kein unparteiisches , auf ORG beruhendes ORG über den erhobenen strafrechtlichen PERSON eingeschritten ” ) . As the authorities imposing the surcharges had failed to hold an oral hearing , the applicant company asked ORG for a public hearing .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG declined to deal with the applicant company ’s complaint under LAW for lack of prospect of success .
CARDINAL . ORG dismissed the applicant company ’s complaint on DATE and held as follows :
“ The present case does not differ in the questions of relevance to the decision from the one decided by ORG on DATE , no . CARDINAL . Pursuant to LAW reference is made to it .

For the reasons set out in that decision the breach of law complained of by the applicant company also does not exist in view of the present complaint , for which reason it can be dismissed without further proceedings in camera .
For the reasons set out in the decision referred to also LAW is of no relevance here . ”

CARDINAL . The Federal Act Establishing the Market Regulation Institution “ GPE ” , ORG DATE ( Bundesgesetz über die Errichtung der Marktordnungsstelle “ GPE ” , BGBl MONEY DATE “ LAW ” ) defines “ GPE ( “ ORG ” ) ” as a corporate body under public law ( LAW paragraph CARDINAL ) . Its tasks comprise , inter alia , the promotion of agricultural marketing ( LAW paragraph CARDINAL ( CARDINAL ) ) .

CARDINAL . According to LAW section CARDINALa AMA collects agricultural marketing charges ( ORG ) for the following aims : ( i ) promoting and securing the distribution of domestic agricultural and forestry products and related processed goods , ( ii ) opening up and maintaining markets for these products in GPE and abroad , ( iii ) improving the distribution of these products , ( iv ) promoting general measures for improving and maintaining the quality of these products ( in particular agricultural products ) and for providing relevant information to the consumer regarding the quality of the products and ( v ) promoting other marketing measures ( in particular by means of offering its services and bearing personnel costs ) .

CARDINAL . ORG finances its activities by levying charges . Under Section CARDINALc in conjunction with sections DATE of LAW , inter alia , individuals and companies operating establishments for slaughtering and butchery of cattle , calves , pigs , lambs and sheep are liable to ORG for agricultural marketing charges . The duty to pay these charges arises at the time the animals are slaughtered ( LAW section LANGUAGE paragraph CARDINAL ( CARDINAL ) ) .
CARDINAL . Section QUANTITY g of LAW , in so far as relevant , reads as follows :

“ ( CARDINAL ) A debtor in respect of the charge has to submit a declaration of the charge due within the time - limit set out in section CARDINALf para . CARDINAL or CARDINAL , making use of a standard form provided for this purposes by ORG , in which he himself has to calculate , ... the charge to be paid ...

( CARDINAL ) If the debtor has not paid the charge at all , not paid in due time or not in the correct amount , ORG has to make an order for payment of the charge , issuing a formal written decision .

( CARDINAL ) If ORG establishes that the charge was not paid at all or not paid in the correct amount , it may increase up to double the amount due . In fixing the increased amount , it must be taken into account to what extent the debtor could be expected to be aware of the debt and whether the non - payment or insufficient payment had occurred for the first time or repeatedly . In cases of late payment ORG may impose default interest exceeding the base interest rate ( PERSON ) by PERCENT , unless this would constitute unacceptable hardship in the individual case . ”

CARDINAL . The collection of the charges is incumbent on the ORG . Appeals against its declaratory decisions can be made to the Federal Minister for ORG . The ORG and the Federal Minister are tax authorities within the meaning of section CARDINAL para . CARDINAL of LAW ( Bundesabgabenordnung ) . The Federal Minister is also the superior supervisory authority ( LAW section CARDINALi ( CARDINAL ) ) .

CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL of LAW provides that non - compliance with the duty to submit a declaration of the charges due or non - payment of the charges caused by untrue or incomplete statements is an administrative offence for which the district administrative authority may impose a fine of up to ORG CARDINAL,CARDINAL or imprisonment in default , unless the act constitutes a criminal offence falling within the jurisdiction of the ordinary criminal courts or is subject to more severe penalties according to other provisions of the administrative criminal law . The district administrative authority has to inform the ORG about the outcome of any such administrative criminal proceedings pending before it .
CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) of the Administrative Court Act provides :

" In so far as ORG does not find any unlawfulness deriving from the respondent authority ’s lack of jurisdiction or from breaches of procedural rules ( section CARDINAL(CARDINAL)(CARDINAL ) and ( CARDINAL ) ) ... , it must examine the impugned decision on the basis of the facts found by the respondent authority and with reference to the complaints put forward ... If it considers that reasons which have not yet been notified to CARDINAL of the parties might be decisive for ruling on [ CARDINAL of these complaints ] ... , it must hear the parties on this point and adjourn the proceedings if necessary . "
CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) of the same LAW states that , save as otherwise provided , ORG must either dismiss an application as ill - founded or quash the impugned decision .
CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) provides that
" the ORG shall quash the impugned decision if it is unlawful
CARDINAL . ORG by reason of its content , [ or ]
CARDINAL . because the respondent authority lacked jurisdiction , [ or ]
CARDINAL . on account of a breach of procedural rules , in that
( a ) the respondent authority has made findings of fact which are , in an important respect , contradicted by the case file , or
( b ) the facts require further investigation on an important point , or
( c ) procedural rules have been disregarded , compliance with which could have led to a different decision by the respondent authority . "
CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) of the Administrative Court Act provides :
“ Every decision ( Erkenntnis ) must be reasoned . Insofar as questions of law have been clarified in the previous case - law , it is sufficient to refer to it . ”

CARDINAL . If ORG quashes the impugned decision , " the administrative authorities [ are ] under a duty ... to take immediate steps , using the legal means available to them , to bring about in the specific case the legal situation which corresponds to ORG view of the law ( PERSON ) " ( section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) ) .

CARDINAL . NORP In its decision of DATE , no . ORG decided on a complaint against a decision of the Federal Minister of ORG levying ORG contributions for DATE - that is for the period following ORG approval of the ORG state aid programme on DATE .

CARDINAL . ORG found that the Federal Minister had decided correctly when he had dismissed the appeal against the imposition of ORG charges for DATE and had interrupted proceedings on contributions in respect of periods before that date , pending the outcome of proceedings before ORG concerning a similar question .

CARDINAL . As regards the period after DATE ORG contributions were due because ORG had given its positive decision before that date . Insofar the appellant had argued that the decision of ORG was wrong and proceedings against that decision were pending before ORG found that , according to the case - law of ORG , an alleged unlawfulness of a state aid affected the levying of contributions for financing that state aid only under specific circumstances , namely if there was a direct link between the amount of state aid granted and the amount levied as contribution . Since this was not the case as regards the ORG contributions , any alleged irregularity of the state aid had no relevance for its financing . For the same reason there was also no breach of LAW establishing ORG ( now LAW on the functioning of ORG ) .

CARDINAL . ORG also declined to hold an oral hearing in this case because the levying of parafiscal contributions , which was the subject mater of the proceedings at issue , did not involve the determination of a dispute on civil rights or obligations . Accordingly Article CARDINAL of the Convention did not require an oral hearing .
CARDINAL . In a judgment of CARDINAL DATE ( G CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) ORG held :

" From the fact that it has been necessary to extend the reservation in respect of LAW to cover the procedural safeguards of LAW , because of the connection between those CARDINAL provisions , it follows that , conversely , the limited review ( die ( bloß ) nachprüfende PERSON ) carried out by ORG or ORG is insufficient in respect of criminal penalties within the meaning of the Convention that are not covered by the reservation . "
